intro: Centropogon aquilinus var. integer, commonly known as the smooth centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and produces clusters of vibrant orange or red flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
